DOC.brief_title: Living With Fibromyalgia : Triggers , Subgroups , Cognitive-Behavioral Interactive Technology-Based Intervention
DOC.detailed_description: Fibromyalgia ( FM ) may currently common rheumatic diagnosis rheumatologist among female patient , 15-20 % new rheumatology referral meeting 1990 American College Rheumatology ( ACR ) diagnosis criterion fibromyalgia . People fibromyalgia live widespread musculoskeletal chronic pain , fatigue , psychological distress , exhibit diminished physical performance due part cycle pain adversely affect activity participation overall well-being . The purpose prospective mixed method study conduct semi-structured qualitative interview use ethnographic technique examine personal experience woman live fibromyalgia . The specific aim study identify clinically relevant “ trigger ” fibromyalgia symptom examine impact activity limitation participation restriction .
DOC.criteria: ( 1 ) At least 18 year age ; ( 2 ) meet American College Rheumatology ( ACR ) criteria FM diagnose physician ; ( 3 ) diagnose FM least 1 year prior admission study ; ( 4 ) sufficient vision , base functional vision test ( i.e. , read newsprint ) operate computer program ; ( 5 ) speak English ; ( 6 ) private telephone line . ( 1 ) Living beyond 40mile radius Oakland campus University Pittsburgh . ( 2 ) Disability everyday task related diagnosis FM ( e.g. , stroke , Parkinson disease ) also ground exclusion .
